applications.name: Google Sheets
applications.description: Google Sheets is a cloud-based spreadsheet application for creating, editing, and analyzing data with formulas, charts, and collaborative features. It includes accessibility support with screen reader compatibility and keyboard navigation throughout cells and menus.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Forward Slash together to open searchable keyboard shortcuts reference dialog.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce shortcuts dialog opened. Search for specific shortcuts or browse categories.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Forward Slash together to search all menu commands and features in Google Sheets.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box. Type command name to quickly access menu items.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Down Arrow together to switch to the next sheet tab in the workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new sheet name. Navigate between sheets efficiently.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Up Arrow together to switch to the previous sheet tab in the workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous sheet name.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to jump to cell A1, the first cell in the sheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell A1 and read its content. Quick way to return to sheet start.

shortcuts.action: Move to last cell with data
shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to jump to the last cell containing data in the used range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell address and content. Finds bottom-right cell of data.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to move to the first cell (column A) in the current row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce column A cell and read content.

shortcuts.description: Press End to move to the last cell with data in the current row or column boundary.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last cell address and content in row.

shortcuts.description: Press Down Arrow to move active cell down one row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content. Standard navigation method.

shortcuts.description: Press Up Arrow to move active cell up one row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Right Arrow to move active cell right one column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Left Arrow to move active cell left one column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content.

shortcuts.action: Move to edge of data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control and an Arrow key to jump to the edge of continuous data region in that direction.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell at edge of data. Efficient navigation through large datasets.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and G together to open Go To dialog for jumping to specific cell reference.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog opened. Type cell address like A1 or B5 and press Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press F2 to enter edit mode for the active cell, allowing you to modify cell contents.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce edit mode active and read cell content. Cursor positioned at end of content.

shortcuts.description: Press Enter to begin editing the active cell, or when already editing, move to cell below.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce edit mode or cell below when finishing edit.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to cancel current cell edit and discard changes, returning to previous value.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce edit cancelled. Cell reverts to original content.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Delete to clear content from selected cell or cells while preserving formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell cleared. Content removed but formatting remains.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to copy content from top cell down to all selected cells below.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fill down completed. Copies value from first selected cell to rest of selection.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and R together to copy content from left cell right to all selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fill right completed. Copies value from leftmost selected cell.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Semicolon together to insert today's date in the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce date inserted. Uses default date format for spreadsheet.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Semicolon together to insert current time in the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce time inserted. Uses default time format.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Enter together to enter an array formula that applies to multiple cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce array formula entered. Creates formula affecting range of cells.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make cell content bold or remove bold formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce bold formatting applied depending on verbosity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to italicize cell content or toggle italic off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting based on settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline cell content or remove underline.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 5 together to apply strikethrough formatting to cell content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce strikethrough applied.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to center align cell content horizontally.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce center alignment when checking cell formatting.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and L together to left align cell content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce left alignment applied.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and R together to right align cell content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce right alignment in cell formatting.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 1 together to apply border to top edge of selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce border formatting. Visual formatting only.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 2 together to apply border to right edge of selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce border changes. Visual formatting.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 3 together to apply border to bottom edge of selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce borders. Visual cell separator.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 4 together to apply border to left edge of selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce border formatting.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 6 together to remove all borders from selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce border removal.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 7 together to apply borders to all edges of all selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce all borders applied.

shortcuts.context: When cell with number is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 4 together to format selected cells as currency with dollar sign and two decimal places.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formatted value including currency symbol when navigating to cell.

shortcuts.context: When cell with number is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 5 together to format selected cells as percentage with percent sign.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read percentage value when navigating to formatted cells.

shortcuts.context: When cell with number is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 1 together to format selected cells as decimal numbers with two decimal places.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read formatted decimal value with proper precision.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Backslash together to remove all formatting from selected cells while keeping content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formatting cleared. Returns cells to default formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Equals together, then optionally R to insert new row above current row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce row inserted. New blank row added above selection.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Equals together, then optionally C to insert new column to left of current column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce column inserted. New blank column added to left.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Minus together, then optionally R to delete selected row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce row deleted. Row removed and content lost permanently.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Minus together, then optionally C to delete selected column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce column deleted. Column removed with all data.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and 9 together to hide selected row from view without deleting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce row hidden. Data preserved but not visible or navigable.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and 0 together to hide selected column from view without deleting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce column hidden. Data preserved but not accessible.

shortcuts.context: When rows around hidden row are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 9 together to unhide rows within the selected range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce rows unhidden. Hidden rows become visible again.

shortcuts.context: When columns around hidden column are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 0 together to unhide columns within the selected range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce columns unhidden. Hidden columns restored to view.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Space together to select the entire row containing the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce entire row selected and row number.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Space together to select the entire column containing the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce entire column selected and column letter.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all cells in the current sheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all cells selected. Operations apply to entire sheet.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F1 while typing a formula name to show help for that function with syntax and examples.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce help panel opened with function documentation.

shortcuts.description: Type equals sign at the beginning of cell to start entering a formula.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formula mode active. Formula bar shows formula as you type.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Grave Accent together to toggle between showing cell values and formulas.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read formulas when formula display enabled. Shows formula syntax in cells.

shortcuts.context: When typing cell reference in formula
shortcuts.description: Press F4 while cursor is on cell reference to cycle through absolute and relative reference types.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read updated reference. Cycles: A1, $A$1, A$1, $A1.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Equals together to quickly insert SUM function with auto-detected range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce SUM formula inserted. Automatically detects contiguous numbers to sum.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last action or change made to the spreadsheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce what was undone depending on verbosity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo an action that was previously undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action completion.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected cells to clipboard with formatting and formulas.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells copied. Dashed border shows copied selection.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected cells removing them and placing on clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells cut. Cells will be removed when pasted elsewhere.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at active cell location.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce paste completed. Formulas adjust references for new location.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and V together to paste only values without formulas or formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce values pasted. Converts formulas to static values.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open find dialog for searching cell content in the sheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find dialog opened. Type search term and press Enter to find.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open Find and Replace dialog for searching and replacing values.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with find and replace fields.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open print dialog for printing the spreadsheet or saving as PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog. Configure print area, orientation, and options.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together to add a comment to the selected cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment box opened. Type comment and press Ctrl+Enter to post.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F2 together to add a note to the selected cell for personal reference.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce note dialog opened. Notes are private and not collaborative.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Z together to enable screen reader optimized mode for Google Sheets.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce screen reader support enabled. Improves navigation and formatting announcements.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and C together to have screen reader announce the column header for current cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read column letter and header text if present in first row.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and R together to have screen reader announce the row header for current cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read row number and header text if present in first column.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and P together to announce current cell address and position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell reference like A5 and position in sheet.
